source: have a good ear for language
lemma: have a good ear for language
definitions: To be skilled at hearing and reproducing the sounds, rhythms, and intonation of a language.
To have a natural aptitude for learning and understanding languages, especially their pronunciation and nuances.
examples: She has a good ear for language, picking up new accents quickly.
With his good ear for language, he can mimic different dialects perfectly.
Having a good ear for language is a great asset for a translator.
